RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 59. Maiden Claiming Purse 18500. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FESSIN UP gave chase and raced in the three path on the turn, dueled CORA'S CHOICE through the stretch and took over later yards. The latter gave chase, raced off the rail on the turn and was outfinished in the duel through the stretch. DEVIN ON EARTH raced clear approaching the half mile pole and rated the pace, came under pressure into the turn, rounded the turn at the rail then flattened stride inside the sixteenth pole. HOLY HIP gave chase outside, rounded the turn about the four path and ran evenly in the stretch. LATE NIGHT SPIRIT gave chase through the backstretch, raced at the rail on the turn then flattened inside the eighth pole. FIDDLERSHOTPLEASUR gave chase, rounded the turn off the rail, was eased outward into the lane and finished evenly.

ENTRY.NAME: Fiddlershotpleasur
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,off rail turn,eased out 1/8,even finish outside

ENTRY.NAME: Holy Hip
ENTRY.OWNER: C M Racing Stables LLC and Lewis Jalen

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 66. Claiming Purse 12000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 28 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.

CLAIM.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

RACE.FOOTNOTES: DANCIN IN DUBAI gave chase through the backstretch, raced at the rail on the turn, eased out leaving the turn, dueled through the stretch and took over the final yards. BUBBA G chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path, was outfinished in the duel through the stretch but got up for second the final yards. PERSONAL FINANCE set a pressured pace inside, widened at the rail on the turn, dug in under steady stretch handling but was caught in the final yards. BODYSLAM chased through the backstretch, raced two deep on the turn and finished well. MOTIVATED SPEAKER gave chase, raced in the six path on the turn and passed a rival outside. TANELEER pressured the pace, dropped back toward the quarter pole, raced in the three path on the turn and weakened in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Personal Finance
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail turn,caught final yards

ENTRY.NAME: Bubba G
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Dancin in Dubai
ENTRY.OWNER: Irish Hill Century Farm and McGuire Matthew
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,rail turn,eased out 1/8,dueled lane,up final yards

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Irish Hill Century Farm & Matt McGuire

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 48. Maiden Claiming Purse 18500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DOCTOR PARDO raced in the three path the first turn, started a bid approaching the three eighths pole and took the lead two deep at the quarter, dug in leaving the turn and held well under steady handling. COLONIAL ROAD settled off the pace in the two and three paths, picked up the chase approaching the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the five path and got up for second in later yards. BAND TOUR saved ground on the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole and raced at the rail on the far turn, eased outward leaving the turn and finished evenly to take third the final yards. ASTRAYAL stalked off the rail, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and flattened the final sixteenth. LAST PARTY ducked in and made sharp contact with Gettin Spicy then moved to the inside and rated the pace, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, was met at the rail at the quarter pole and weakened leaving the far turn. KING OF LUCK rated close inside on the first turn, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and weakened in the lane. ALL ROADS TO DENIS ducked out and made contact with GETTIN SPICY leaving the gate, raced in the four path the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. The latter was jostled then pinched back leaving the gate and never factored.

ENTRY.NAME: Colonial Road
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 2& 3p,chased 3/8,5p far turn,up 2nd later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Last Party
ENTRY.OWNER: Don't Chasem Replacem Racing and Armstrong Katina M
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked in,bumped break,rated pace inside,met rail 1/4,weakened

ENTRY.NAME: King of Luck
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,chased past 7/16,off rail far turn,weaekened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 80. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 21800. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE JULY 28, 2021 OR CLAIMING PRICE $10,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Sinc e June 28 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 28 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000 (Races Where Entered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TIZ THE REASON took an immediate lead and moved to the inside to rate the early pace, came under pressure nearing the quarter pole, raced at the rail on the turn and dug in determinedly to keep the edge. COACH RUBE chased and raced close off the rail on the turn then dug in gamely to the wire. CASTLE LIGHTS gave chase, raced in the three path on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. SECRET CASTLE chased inside, raced at the rail on the turn and showed little in the lane. JUBA'S HOUSE gave chase, rounded the turn about the three path and weakened. GOT YOUR NUMBER gave chase, raced in the three path on the turn and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Coach Rube
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,close off rail turn,game to wire

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 61. Claiming Purse 19600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 28 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, if for $12,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TRUE FLIRT moved to the inside and rated the pace, came under pressure leaving the five sixteenths pole, widened at the rail on the far turn and was kept alert through the lane. IHEARTRAINACOMN raced boxed at the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and dug in to take second later yards. OUR GREAT NOTION stalked from the three path the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path then flattened inside the sixteenth pole. DEREKA'S BLUFF entered the first turn in the five path and left the turn outside, steadily progressed through the backstretch and raced close off the rail on the far turn, though, flattened toward mid-stretch. AMELIA'S DREAM stalked off the rail the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn. PRINCESS HALO rounded the first turn in the four path, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn and weakened in the lane. PATTI BLUE EYES stalked from the four path the first turn, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole, entered the far turn in the five path then weakened leaving the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Iheartrainacomn
ENTRY.COMMENT: boxed rail 1st turn,chased 7/16,rail far turn,up 2nd later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Amelia's Dream
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,chased 3/8,weakened rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: True Flirt
ENTRY.OWNER: Rogers Louie and Lewis Jr William R
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 5/16,widened rail turn,kept alert

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Louie Rogers Thoroughbreds LLC & William R Lewis

ENTRY.NAME: Patti Blue Eyes
ENTRY.OWNER: Fanelli John Cash is King LLC and LC Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 4p 1st turn,chased past 7/16,5p into far turn,weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 62. Claiming Purse 18500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 28 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8, 000 1 lb. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).

CLAIM.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAY MAYS CASTLE was bumped leaving the gate and rounded the first turn in the three path, closed to the lead four wide approaching the five sixteenths pole, dueled clear past the quarter and was steadily handled to hold on. HERETODAYGONMANANA stalked from the four path the first turn then moved to even terms into the backstretch and dueled from that point, angled in approaching the quarter pole, raced at the rail on the far turn, drifted outward and exchanged contact with TENNIS TAP nearing mid-stretch then dueled the remainder for second. The latter saved ground on the first turn then eased out into the backstretch, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn but lugged in and exchanged contact with Heretodaygonmanana toward mid-stretch and was outfinished for second. BLUE MOUNTAIN became anxious in the gate then took over and angled to the inside to rate the pace, was met into the backstretch and dueled from that point, but was pinched back at the rail approaching the quarter pole, angled out leaving the turn and showed little further. REAL APPEAL stalked the early pace from the two and three paths, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the four path and ran evenly in the lane. MAKINLIMMARGARITAS became edgy in the gate then ducked inward and into May Mays Castle, rated close inside on the first turn, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn and showed little in the lane. The Stewards reviewed a claim of foul against the rider of Heretodaygonmanana for interference approaching the quarter pole, lodged by the rider of Blue Mountain and as a result, disqualified the former to fourth place for coming in on the latter nearing the quarter pole. In addition, the rider of Heretodaygonmanana claimed foul against the rider of May Mays Castle for alleged interference in the vicinity of the quarter pole, but that claim was rejected.

ENTRY.NAME: May Mays Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,3p 1st turn,up 4wd near 5/16,clear turn,held on

ENTRY.NAME: Makinlimmargaritas
ENTRY.OWNER: Eastham Richard and Brown Ronney W

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 7F Dirt CR: 72. Allowance Purse 31600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 28 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 28 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Wher e Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAGGIE'S GIRL took the lead at the thirteen sixteenths pole and moved to the inside to rate the pace, was urged away from the five sixteenths, raced at the rail on the far turn and was steadily handled in the lane. JUBA BABY rated off the early pace inside, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and settled for second best. NO DENYING DENIS veered out leaving the gate and rounded the opening turn about the four path, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn then weakened in the lane. EX RATED was forced out at the break and raced well back inside, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and passed rivals in the lane. STRONG WILLED rounded the first turn two deep, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn and weakened. LOVE OF GRACE showed little response through the backstretch. LONG LEGS LOUISE became edgy in the gate and mostly saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Juba Baby
ENTRY.OWNER: Two Ten Twelve Triple T Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace inside,chased 3/8,rail far turn,settled 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Strong Willed
ENTRY.OWNER: Nikki Horses Racing and Fanelli John

ENTRY.NAME: Maggie's Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,urged away 5/16,rail far turn,driving finish

ENTRY.NAME: Long Legs Louise
ENTRY.OWNER: Rogers Louie and Lewis Jr William R

ENTRY.NAME: No Denying Denis
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered out break,4p 1st turn,chased 3/8,3p far turn,weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Ex Rated
ENTRY.COMMENT: forced out break,well back inside,bid 3/8,off rail,passed rivals

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 86. Starter Allowance Purse 20700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE JULY 28, 2021. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 28 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 28 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Ent ered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COWBOY AT HEART gave chase and raced close at the rail on the turn, eased out entering the stretch and dug in to take over the final yards. GOLDEN G gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the three path and finished well while dueling for second. MONTAUK DADDY chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the four path and was outfinished in the stretch duel for second. MR TINGLES dueled for the early lead and set a pressured pace inside, raced at the rail on the turn, dug in under steady stretch handling but was overcome later yards. DAY THE MUSIC DIED chased through the backstretch, raced close three wide on the turn but flattened later yards. GRUMPELSTILTSKIN was bumped leaving the gate, chased through the backstretch, raced at the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. STEVETHEVANDRIVER veered out and made contact with Grumpelstiltskin leaving the gate, pressured the early pace then faded at the rail on the turn. GAMING JACK saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Mr Tingles
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail turn,over come later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Stevethevandriver
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered out,bumped break,pressed pace,faded rail turn

ENTRY.NAME: Cowboy At Heart
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,close rail turn,eased out 1/8,up final yards
